data.title: Keyscape not loading sound source!
data.meta_description:
Ok, I feel like some kind of rush today - so I'm gonna pull the trigger and update everything to the latest versions. :suicide::hahaha:

ATM I have the...
data.text:
Yes I'm on Mac and I have so many great keyboard libraries, I have no desire to cause Omnisphere to self destruct for me to have another another Rhodes or Clavinet.

Agree x 1

List

Hi guys, first of all, thank you all for your comments, this post saved my sanity!

Still have a problem to solve though

Basically I have an external HDD with all my plugins, including the dreaded "STEAM" folder. I run my libraries on 3 separate systems, 2 of which as Windows 10 based. On these, everything runs fantastic! Trilian, Keyscape and Omnisphere 2 run all perfect and all instruments can be accessed/selected from the Omnisphere 2 browser.

My issue is the 3 system, which runs OSX on a Mac Pro. Everything is updated to the latest version BUT when "checking for updates" within Omnisphere 2, I can see that all the patches version are shown as v0.0. Then when loading from Omnisphere I get "soundsource not found", database incomplete, etc.

As far as I can guess it must be either:

- The fact that the external drive is formatted in NTFS and I used Paragon NTFS+ on the Mac to read/write on the HDD itself

- Maybe the zmap created in Windows is not good enough for OSx

I mean, I know the structure of the STEAM folder itself has to be right because the other 2 PCs are not complaining about it. Yet, it must be something to do with the STEAM folder because when I tested the official Omnisphere 2 authorisation (I own that one) it still came up with the same errors, so it can't be the VST or Software side of things. The only thing that makes sense is the HDD format.

I'm going to run a test using a completely separate HDD formatted for Apple OSx, but before I mess around with 170GB of data, does anyone have any similar issues or experience with this problem?

Thanks

Useful x 1

List

Hi Mottel, sorry my English ...

when you say you have the correct versions of Omnisphere, which versions are you referring to?

I also had the same problem, but I solved doing all the right updates.

If by chance you had not read, I attach the links of the forum, where I explain how I did it!

There are images where you see the before and after the cure!

https://audiosex.pro/threads/keyscape-not-loading-sound-source.31130/page-3

Hi, if you have the version of omnisphere installed and it is version 3.2.1,

all you need to do is upgrade your version to 3.2.2, creating an account for yourself on the Spectrasonics website and downloading all the updates you need to bring the software along with its satellites to work properly ...

I paste the links kindly posted by Pinkman:

https://www.spectrasonics.net/support/ua-omnisphere2-updates.php

https://www.spectrasonics.net/support/ua-keyscape-updates.php

https://www.spectrasonics.net/support/ua-trilian-updates.php

https://www.spectrasonics.net/support/ua-stylusrmx-updates.php

Use the [LEGACY DOWNLOAD AREA] for the older revisions.

in addition I also paste the link of the forum where I posted the images that highlight

omnisphere before and after updates:

https://audiosex.pro/threads/keyscape-not-loading-sound-source.31130/page-3

I hope I have been helpful

below all the files I downloaded to update everything:

Omnisphere_Software_Update_Win_2_3_2h

Keyscape_Patch_Library_Update_1_1d

Keyscape_Software_Update_Win_1_0_2c

Keyscape_Soundsource_Library_Update_1_0_2

I have the 2.4 version and everything thing is updated Iâ€™m still getting the soundsource for keyscape error
